title: Nurse
summaries: The Nurse is an NPC that will spawn once the following criteria have been met:

• There is an empty house.
  • The player's maximum health is greater than 100.
  • The Merchant is present.
The Nurse will heal the player's health and cure them of any active debuffs at the cost of Coins (there are exceptions, see Notes and History).

In the 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] and [img:Legacy tModLoader version] Legacy tModLoader versions, healing costs can range from a few Copper to several Silver Coins, depending on how much health the player is missing. She charges Copper equal to 75% of the health restored (e.g. 75 for restoring 100 health), plus an additional 750 for every active debuff on the player.

In the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, healing costs are 1 per health restored, plus an additional 1 per active debuff on the player, all multiplied by the Nurse's current Happiness price adjustment, and then doubled if playing on Expert Mode. Also, the Nurse charges increasing amounts of money for healing as the game progresses; these specific increases are detailed below. Thus, at the start of the game, the cost of restoring 100 health can range from 75 / 150 (with maximum happiness) to 150 / 3 (with maximum unhappiness), while by endgame it can range from 150 / 3 up to 3 / 6.

In the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, and [img:Legacy tModLoader version] Legacy tModLoader version, she will fight enemies by throwing [img:Poison Syringe] syringes that will deal 8 / <abbr class="expert" title="Expert Mode">12</abbr> / <abbr class="master" title="Master Mode">14</abbr> damage (affected by various stat boosts), and poison enemies for 3–5 seconds. She can also use [img:Healing Syringe] healing syringes to heal herself and other nearby NPCs for 20 health.

statistics.Damage: 81214 (Syringe)
